p: There has also been relatively little attention to the gender implications of crop preferences. Many rural African smallholder societies are patriarchal and men make most of the agricultural decisions for the household, even though women are often the providers of food for the family. However, in polygamous households, common in Mali, women often manage land and make agricultural decisions independent of their husbands. In addition to examining the differences in tradeoffs embodied by perennial and hybrid crops, we specifically consider the variation in preferences among attributes of hybrid and perennial varieties of sorghum between male and female farmers.
